"]}},"

",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"Here are some example sentences using the word "treacherous" in different contexts:"}},"
",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["

",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"Here, "treacherous" describes a physical place that is hazardous and potentially life-threatening."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":[{"type":"strong","key":"0","props":{"children":"Betrayal in a Relationship"}},": "She felt heartbroken after discovering her best friend's treacherous actions.""]}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"In this context, "treacherous" describes a betrayal in a personal relationship, indicating that someone was deceitful or disloyal."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":[{"type":"strong","key":"0","props":{"children":"Weather Conditions"}},": "The captain decided to delay the voyage due to treacherous weather conditions at sea.""]}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"Here, "treacherous" refers to weather that is unstable and poses a risk, potentially leading to dangerous situations."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"7","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":[{"type":"strong","key":"0","props":{"children":"Unpredictable Behavior"}},": "The politician was known for his treacherous nature, often changing his stance when it suited him.""]}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"This usage of "treacherous" suggests inconsistency and the potential for sudden changes that can be harmful or deceptive."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"In all these examples, "treacherous" implies a sense of danger, betrayal, or instability, whether referring to a literal physical threat or a figurative, relational, or behavioral one."}},"

"}},"

",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["

"]}},"

",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["

"]}},"
"]}},"

"]}},"
"]}},"

"]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"In the user-given sentence, the phrase "forked tongue" is used metaphorically to refer to someone who is deceitful or is lying. Gandalf is essentially telling someone to stop lying or speaking deceitfully."}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"Here are some example sentences using "forked tongue" in different contexts:"}},"

",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["

"]}},"
"]}},"

",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""During the debate, the politician was accused of speaking with a forked tongue, making promises he had no intention of keeping.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":[{"type":"em","key":"0","props":{"children":"Speaking in an insincere manner"}},":"]}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""He spoke with a forked tongue, flattering his boss while secretly undermining her efforts.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"Note that outside of metaphorical use referring to deceit and the literal anatomical reference to a snake, "forked tongue" doesn't typically have other distinct meanings."}},"

",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"Here are some example sentences showing other meanings or uses of the term "bandy":"}},"
",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["

",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"The politicians bandied words during the debate, each trying to gain the upper hand."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"To discuss or pass back and forth casually:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"At the meeting, they bandied around ideas for the new project until they found a suitable direction."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"To toss or hit back and forth (as if in a game):"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"The children bandied the ball across the field, laughing as they played."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"Each of these examples highlights "bandy" used in different contexts, illustrating its core aspect of exchange, whether it be words, ideas, or physical objects."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":["Gandalf: I have not passed through fire and death to bandy crooked words with a ",{"type":"b","key":null,"props":{"children":"witless worm"}}]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"The phrase "witless worm" in the given sentence is used as an insult. "Witless" means lacking intelligence or foolish, and "worm" can be used derogatorily to refer to someone considered to be of low status or contemptible. Together, the phrase "witless worm" implies someone who is both foolish and insignificant or contemptible."}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"The phrase can be broken down into two parts that have meanings on their own:"}},"
",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Witless:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"Example: "He made a witless decision by investing all his money in a scam.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"In this sentence, "witless" refers to a lack of good judgment or intelligence."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Worm:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"Example: "He felt like a worm when he had to admit his mistake in front of everyone.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"Here, "worm" is being used metaphorically to describe someone feeling low or humiliated."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"The combined usage, as in "witless worm," suggests a more intensified criticism by combining both lack of intelligence and lowliness. "}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"8","props":{"children":"Here are example sentences to illustrate the phrase, albeit in different contexts:"}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"10","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""After his cunning scheme was revealed, the self-proclaimed genius looked every bit the witless worm he was accused of being.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":""Stop behaving like a witless worm and start taking responsibility for your actions.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":""Despite his bravado, he was treated like a witless worm by those who knew the truth about his failures.""}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"12","props":{"children":"These examples show how the phrase can be used metaphorically to criticize someone's intelligence and character."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":["King: Your leechcraft would have had me crawling ",{"type":"b","key":null,"props":{"children":"on all fours"}}," like a beast"]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"In the given sentence, the phrase "on all fours" refers to moving on hands and feet, similar to the way quadrupedal animals like dogs or cats move. "]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":[{"type":"strong","key":"0","props":{"children":"Implying Subservience or Submission"}},":"]}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["

"]}},"
"]}},"

"]}},"

"]}},"

"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"King's Daughter: to stay behind the bar until use and old age accept them"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"The phrase "behind the bar" in this context refers to the idea of something or someone being kept in reserve or out of direct action until a later time, such as when they are needed or when the situation requires it. Here, it might metaphorically refer to the daughters being kept away from the public scene or active roles until they are accepted due to use (utility) and old age."}},"

",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":[{"type":"em","key":"0","props":{"children":"Example"}},": "After college, Mike decided to work behind the bar at a local pub to save up some money.""]}},"

It suggests that there is nothing left in the person but lies and deceit, implying they have no other qualities or attributes remaining."]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"The term "naught" is often considered a more archaic or poetic way to express "nothing," but it still appears in modern usage. Here are some example sentences to illustrate its other usages:"}},"
",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Mathematical Context:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""In the equation, the variable can be naught if the conditions are met." "}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"This usage indicates that the value of the variable can be zero under certain conditions."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Old or Poetic Expressions:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""All my efforts to please him were for naught.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"This means that all efforts were in vain or had no effect."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Descriptive Usage (Literary):"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""Their once thriving settlement was reduced to naught by the storm.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"Here, it suggests that the community or settlement has been completely destroyed or reduced to nothing because of the storm."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"7","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Figurative Speech:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""Her kindness was met with naught but suspicion.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"In this example, "naught but suspicion" means that the only response to her kindness was suspicion."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"These examples show how "naught" can be used in different contexts, often implying a sense of zero value, emptiness, or non-existence."}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"Arwen tell the story"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":["Frodo begin to understand the quest will ",{"type":"b","key":null,"props":{"children":"claim"}}," his life"]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"In the sentence, the phrase "claim" his life means that the quest will likely lead to Frodo's death. Here, "claim" is used to suggest that the quest will take his life away or cause him to die as a result."}},"

",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["

"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"State something as a fact or belief:"}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"The scientist claims that the new treatment can cure the disease."}},"

"]}},"
"]}},"

"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"

"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":["In the ",{"type":"b","key":null,"props":{"children":"gathering"}}," dark, the will of the Ring grow strong."]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"In the user-given sentence, "gathering" refers to darkness gradually accumulating or increasing as night falls. It evokes a sense of encroaching shadows and a transition from light to dark, adding to the ominous atmosphere associated with the Ring's growing influence."}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"The word "gathering" can have other meanings depending on context. Here are a few examples to illustrate those meanings:"}},"
",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"Gathering as a noun meaning an assembly or meeting:"}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""We are hosting a small gathering of friends at our house this weekend.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":""The annual gathering of the book club members is scheduled for next Saturday.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"Gathering as a verb meaning collecting or bringing together:"}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""She was gathering her things quickly to leave the office before the storm hit.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":""Farmers are busy gathering the harvest during this time of year.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"These examples reflect the versatility of the word "gathering" in various contexts, conveying meanings related to assembling people, accumulating items, or the gradual convergence of elements."}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"Frodo see Faramir"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":["Frodo (talking about Gollom): This creature is ",{"type":"b","key":null,"props":{"children":"bound to"}}," me, he is our guide"]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":["In the sentence "This creature is ",{"type":"b","key":"1","props":{"children":"bound to"}}," me, he is our guide," the phrase "bound to" implies that Gollum is obligated or has a duty to serve Frodo in some way. It suggests a sense of commitment or a strong connection, as if Gollum is tethered or tied to Frodo for the purpose of guiding him."]}},"

",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"After such a heated argument, they were bound to have some friction at work."}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"With such persistent determination, she is bound to succeed in her endeavors."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Physically Tied or Secured:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"The package was bound to the courier’s bicycle to ensure it didn’t fall off during delivery."}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"The climbers were bound to each other with ropes for added safety on the mountain."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Headed Towards a Destination:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"The train is bound to New York, and it leaves in fifteen minutes."}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":"They boarded the ship bound to the Caribbean for their summer vacation."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"These examples show how "bound to" can indicate obligation or duty, high likelihood, physical constraints, or destination orientation."}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":" Aragorn got back "}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":["You are the luckiest, canniest and the most ",{"type":"b","key":null,"props":{"children":"reckless"}}," man I ever know"]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"The phrase "reckless" in this context refers to someone who acts without considering the potential risks or consequences of their actions. It implies a kind of boldness or daring, but also a lack of caution or forethought."}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"Here are some example sentences that illustrate other meanings or nuances of the word "reckless":"}},"
",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Carefree or Unrestrained:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""The reckless abandon with which the children played in the park reminded the adults of their own youth.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Headstrong or Impulsive:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""His reckless decision to quit his job without another lined up surprised everyone.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Negligent or Irresponsible:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""Driving at such high speeds on icy roads is not just reckless, it's downright dangerous.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"7","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Bold or Adventurous (without negative connotation):"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""Her reckless courage in traveling the world alone inspired many of her friends to do the same.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"Each of these sentences showcases how "reckless" can be used in slightly different contexts, reflecting varying degrees of risk-taking and responsibility."}},"
"]}}]}}}}]}}
